results.title: The Persistent seed
results.creator_credit: Christopher Chapman, Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film by Christopher Chapman, known for his lyrical films of countryside and wilderness. He turns his colour camera on the growing city and there finds cheering proof that despite concrete and bulldozer, the persistent seed prevails. The film is without commentary and the camera work is a constant delight, for Chapman has the gift of catching life smiling wherever he may look. Film without words.

results.title: The Performing bear
results.creator_credit: Lliam Amor and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: This hand-painted animation has no narration, but the story is simply and beautifully told through the use of images. It is the tale of a travelling circus, whose only performer is a brown bear, which is badly treated by it’s cruel master. Due to waning interest in the performance of the star act, the circus master closes the circus and sells the bear to three men who, unbeknownst to him, wish to set the bear free, only to hunt it down. The bear eludes his would-be killers, finds a deserted tricycle and escapes to freedom using his talents. The film provides a beautiful metaphor for the triumph of the human spirit under the weight of great oppression, if we rely on our wits and use our skills and talents to provide the strength and opportunity required to escape our bonds, anything is possible.

results.title: The Perfectionist
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.brief_description: Stuart Gunn (John Waters) is a perfectionist. Barbara (Jacki Weaver) is his long suffering wife. Stuart and Barbara reach a crossroads in their relationship when she wishes to return to the workforce whilst he wants her to stay at home. Finally, Barbara wins out and a babysitter is hired, though not the usual stereotype. He is a tall, blond and handsome Scandinavian called Erik. Without warning the roles of Stuart and Barbara have been reversed - but who is the better off? Starring Jacki Weaver, John Waters, Noel Ferrier and Steven Vidler. Screenplay by David Williamson from his stageplay.

results.title: The Perfect Storm
results.creator_credit: Baltimore Spring Creek Productions, Radiant Productions, Warner Bros. Pictures, Wolfgang Petersen, William Sandell, Erica Edell Phillips, Paula Weinstein, William D. Wittliff and Gail Katz
results.brief_description: In October 1991, a confluence of weather conditions combined to form a killer storm in the North Atlantic. Caught in the storm was the sword-fishing boat Andrea Gail. Magnificent foreshadowing and anticipation fill this true-life drama while minute details of the fishing boats, their gear and the weather are juxtaposed with the sea adventure.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.
